pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the assign1 experimental robotics package, explaining its purpose as an autonomous ArUco marker navigation system using visual servoing

pages.title: Quick Start Guide
pages.purpose: Provide step-by-step instructions for building, installing dependencies, and launching the complete system

pages.title: System Architecture
pages.purpose: Present the high-level architecture showing how simulation, perception, state estimation, and control layers interact

pages.title: Mission Control System
pages.purpose: Deep dive into the core ArUco mission node implementation - the primary contribution of this package

pages.title: Finite State Machine
pages.purpose: Explain the five-state FSM (SCANNING, SORTING, NAVIGATING, BACKING_UP, FINISHED) that orchestrates the mission

pages.title: Visual Servoing Controller
pages.purpose: Detail the P-controller implementation for angular and linear velocity control during marker approach

pages.title: Implementation Variants
pages.purpose: Compare the two node implementations: external detection vs. internal compressed image processing

pages.title: Robot Models
pages.purpose: Document the two robot configurations available in the system with their kinematic and dynamic properties

pages.title: Differential Drive Robot
pages.purpose: Describe the mogi_bot differential drive configuration with URDF structure and Gazebo plugins

pages.title: Skid-Steer Drive Robot
pages.purpose: Describe the mogi_bot_skid_drive configuration with four-wheel drive and its unique characteristics

pages.title: Sensor Suite
pages.purpose: Detail the complete sensor configuration: camera, IMU, GPS/NavSat, and LiDAR with their parameters

pages.title: Launch System
pages.purpose: Explain the modular launch file architecture and how to start different system configurations

pages.title: Complete System Launch
pages.purpose: Document spawn_robot.launch.py and spawn_skid_steer_robot.launch.py for launching the full simulation environment

pages.title: Component Launch Files
pages.purpose: Explain support launch files: my_launch.py for Gazebo, aruco_tracker.launch.xml for detection, and utilities

pages.title: Launch Arguments and Configuration
pages.purpose: List all configurable launch arguments for world selection, robot spawning, visualization, and simulation time

pages.title: Simulation Environment
pages.purpose: Describe the Gazebo world with ArUco markers and the custom model assets

pages.title: World Definition
pages.purpose: Detail the assignment1.sdf world file including physics, lighting, and the five ArUco box placements

pages.title: ArUco Box Models
pages.purpose: Document the custom ArUco box models with their marker IDs, textures, and SDF structure

pages.title: Configuration Files
pages.purpose: Document the YAML configuration files for EKF sensor fusion and ArUco detection parameters

pages.title: ArUco Detector Settings
pages.purpose: Document the aruco_tracker configuration including dictionary selection and board detection settings

pages.title: Build System and Dependencies
pages.purpose: Explain the CMake build configuration and ROS 2 package dependencies

pages.title: Package Dependencies
pages.purpose: List and explain all ROS 2 and external library dependencies required by the package

pages.title: CMake Build Configuration
pages.purpose: Detail the CMakeLists.txt structure, compilation targets, and installation rules

pages.title: ROS 2 Topic Interface
pages.purpose: Comprehensive reference of all topics published and subscribed by the only the nodes required for the visual servoing tasks without mention of the additional features that are not utilized yet

pages.title: Tuning and Parameters
pages.purpose: Guide for adjusting mission parameters: speeds, distances, gains, and detection thresholds
